label: vaporisation
definition: Vaporisation of an element or compound is process whereby that element or compound undergoes a phase transition from the liquid to vapor.

label: boiling
definition: Boiling is a form of vaporisation which occurs when a liquid is heated to a temperature at which the vapor pressure of the liquid is equal to the pressure exerted on the liquid by the surrounding environmental pressure.

label: hydrological condensation process
definition: Hydrological condensation is a process in which atmospheric water vapour undergoes a phase transition from the gas phase to the liquid phase.

label: climate change
definition: The long-term fluctuations in temperature, precipitation, wind, and all other aspects of the Earth's climate. External processes, such as solar-irradiance variations, variations of the Earth's orbital parameters (eccentricity, precession, and inclination), lithosphere motions, and volcanic activity, are factors in climatic variation. Internal variations of the climate system, e.g., changes in the abundance of greenhouse gases, also may produce fluctuations of sufficient magnitude and variability to explain observed climate change through the feedback processes interrelating the components of the climate system.

label: acidification of an aquatic environment
definition: Acidification of an aquatic environment is a process whereby the pH of an aquatic environment, biome, or water body is lowered.

label: ocean acidification
definition: Ocean acidification is a process during which the pH of a sea or ocean is lowered.

label: ecosystem-wide aerobic respiration
definition: A process which consists of all aerobic respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: volcanic eruption
definition: A volcanic eruption is a process during which lava, tephra (ash, lapilli, volcanic bombs and blocks), and assorted gases are expelled from a volcanic vent or fissure.

label: explosive eruption
definition: An explosive eruption is a volcanic process in which pressurised magma is violently expelled and froths into volcanic ash. Explosive eruptions can eject a cloud of rocks, dust, gas, and pyroclastic material  which may then collapse, creating a pyroclastic flow of hot volcanic matter.

label: effusive eruption
definition: An effusive eruption is a volcanic eruption during which lava flows onto the ground.

label: igneous intrusion process
definition: A process whereby rising magma cools and solidifies without reaching the surface. Instead, the cooled and solidified igneous mass crystallises within the crust to form an igneous intrusion.

label: earthquake
definition: An earthquake is a process during which energy is released in an astronomical body's crust, causing the displacement of crustal parts and the generation of seismic waves.

label: tectonic earthquake
definition: An earthquake caused by the sudden release of energy accumulated in an astronomical body's crust, as the elastic strain placed on constituent rock masses causes them to fracture.

label: megathrust earthquake
definition: A megathrust earthquake is a tectonic earthquake which occurs at subduction zones at destructive plate boundaries (convergent boundaries). These interplate earthquakes are the planet's most powerful, with moment magnitudes that can exceed 9.0.

label: glacial abrasion
definition: A glacial abrasion process is an erosional process during which debris in the basal ice scrapes along the bed, polishing and gouging the underlying rocks, similar to sandpaper on wood.

label: glacial plucking
definition: Glacial plucking is an erosional process during which pieces of bedrock are cracked off due to the mechanical force of a moving glacier.

label: glacial ice thrusting
definition: Glacial ice thrusting is an erosional process during which a moving glacier which has frozen to its bed surges forward and moves large sheets of sediment frozen to the glacial mass.

label: tsunami
definition: A tsunami is a process during which a series of waves is generated in a water body, typically an ocean or large lake, by the displacement of a large volume of water. Earthquakes, volcanic eruptions and other underwater explosions (including detonations of underwater nuclear devices), landslides, glacier calvings, meteorite impacts and other disturbances above or below water all have the potential to generate a tsunami.

label: mass wasting
definition: Mass wasting is the geomorphic process by which solid environmental material such as soil, sand, regolith, and/or rock move downslope typically as a mass, largely under the force of gravity, but frequently affected by water and water content as in submarine environments and mudslides.

label: avalanche
definition: A mass wasting flow during which snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: landslide process
definition: A landslide is a process whereby a large mass of earth and rocks moves down a hill or a mountainside.

label: geological subsidence
definition: A material transport process during which a geological surface shifts downward relative to a datum such as sea-level.

label: mass wasting flow
definition: A mass wasting flow is a form of mass wasting during which the moving materials behave similarly to a flowing fluid. Water, air and ice are often involved in enabling fluidlike motion of the material.

label: mudflow
definition: A mudflow is a form of mass wasting which involves very rapid to extremely rapid surging flow of debris that has become partially or fully liquified by the addition of significant amounts of water to clay-rich source material.

label: debris flow
definition: A mass wasting flow during which water-laden masses of soil and fragmented rock rush down the slopes of elevations, funnel into stream channels, entrain objects in their paths, and form thick, muddy deposits on valley floors.

label: lahar
definition: A lahar is a type of mudflow or debris flow composed of a slurry of pyroclastic material, rocky debris, and water. The material flows down from a volcano, typically along a river valley.

label: sturzstrom
definition: A sturzstrom is a landslide consisting which has a great amount of kinetic energy resulting in greater horizontal movement when compared to its initial vertical drop — as much as 20 or 30 times the vertical distance. By contrast a normal landslide will typically travel a horizontal distance that is less than twice the distance that the material has fallen.

label: ash fall process
definition: An ash fall process is a process in which volcanic ash formed during an explosive volcanic eruption, phreatomagmatic eruption, or during material transport in pyroclastic density currents is pulled towards the planetary surface by gravity.

label: hydrological precipitation process
definition: Hydrological precipitation is a process during which any product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapour is pulled to the planetary surface by gravity.

label: hydrological evaporation
definition: Hydrological evaporation is the evaporation of water, generally as part of a planetary water cycle.

label: soil degradation
definition: Soil degradation is a process which results in a change in soil health status resulting in a diminished capacity of the ecosystem in which the soil occurs to provide goods and services for its  beneficiaries.

label: soil erosion
definition: Soil erosion is a process in which exogenic processes remove soil from one location on the Earth's crust and transport it to another location where it is deposited.

label: coastal flooding
definition: Coastal flooding is a process in which normally dry, low-lying land near a coast is flooded by sea water.

label: riverine flooding
definition: Riverine flooding is a process in which the flow rate of river water exceeds the capacity of its channel, thus flooding neighbouring land. Bends and meanders in a river channel are particularly disposed to such flooding.

label: flash flooding
definition: Flash flooding is a process in which low-lying land is inundated with water for a short period of time and are usually the result of precipitation or a breach in the container of a water body.

label: meteotsunami
definition: A meteotsunami is a tsunami caused by atmospheric processes and differences in air pressure.

label: storm surge process
definition: A storm surge process is a coastal flooding process which is caused by low pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: areal flooding
definition: Areal flooding is a flooding process in which flat or low-lying areas become inundated with water due to water input exceeding infiltration, evaporation, or run off.

label: urban flooding
definition: Urban flooding is a flooding process in which land or property in a built environment, particularly in more densely populated areas, is inundated due to the rate of water input exceeding that of water drainage provided by the environment's drainage systems.

label: snowmelt
definition: Snowmelt is a hydrological melting process in which water is produced by the melting of snow and becomes part of the hydrological surface runoff.

label: hydrological melting process
definition: A melting process during which water-based ice, snow, or other solid phase water transitions into a liquid phase.

label: icemelt
definition: Icemelt is a hydrological melthing process in which water is produced by the melting of ice and becomes part of the hydrological surface runoff.

label: melting
definition: Melting is a material transformation process which results in the phase transition of a substance from a solid to a liquid.

label: condensation process
definition: Condensation is a process during which a gas undergoes a phase transition into a liquid.

label: chemical precipitation process
definition: Chemical precipitation is a process in which a portion of some solid substance segregates from a material in which that substance or its precursors were dissolved in and settles due to a force such as gravity or centrifugal force. Segregation may occur due to the solubility limits of the precipitating substance being exceeded or due to a chemical reaction that forms a solid product from aqueous reagents.

label: desublimation process
definition: Desublimation is a process in which a portion of some gas undergoes a phase transition into a portion of some solid.

label: sublimation process
definition: Sublimation is a process during which a portion of some solid undergoes a phase transition into a portion of some gas.

label: tectonic uplift process
definition: A tectonic uplift process is a geomorphologic process in which a geological surface shifts upward relative to a datum such as sea-level due to forces other than isostatic responses to unloading.

label: atmospheric subsidence
definition: A material transport process during which a mass of air moves through an atmosphere towards a planetary surface.

label: lava flow process
definition: A process in which a volume of lava emitted during an effusive eruption moves along a solid surface.

label: rock-precursor intrusion process
definition: A process whereby the precursors of rock, such as magma or sedimentary particles, fill a fracture in a mass of rock.

label: recycling process
SYNONYMS: Recycling-Prozess|proceso de reciclaje|processo di riciclo|資源回收
definition: A process during which materials deemed as waste are separated and converted into a form which can be used as input by the same processes which generated them.

label: carbon-bearing gas emission process
definition: A carbon emission process is any environmental process which outputs a carbon-bearing gas.

label: land consumption process
definition: A process in which natural ecosystems present over an expanse of land are removed and replaced with anthropogenic ecosystems.

label: carbon dioxide emission process
definition: A carbon emission process is any environmental process which releases carbon dioxide gas into the atmosphere.

label: material extraction process
definition: A planned process during which a portion of environmental material is removed from a material entity.

label: fire
definition: A fire is a process whereby rapid and exothermic oxidation of a material through a combustion process releases heat, light, and other products.

label: wildfire
definition: A conflagration which is uncontrolled and combusts material in a vegetated area, be it rural or wild.

label: conflagration
definition: A fire which occurs in a large spatial area poses a risk to human life, animal life, health, and/or property.

label: forest fire
definition: A wildfire which occurs in a forest, primarily consuming vegetation as fuel.

label: mass gaseous flow
definition: A process whereby a large volume of gas moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: atmospheric wind
SYNONYMS: A mass gaseous flow which occurrs in a planet's atmosphere due to internal pressure disequilibria.|wind

label: stellar wind
definition: A stream of plasma primarily composed of electrons, protons, and alpha particles ejected from the upper atmosphere of a star.

label: planetary wind
SYNONYMS: A mass gaseous flow in which planetary atmospheric gases flow into outer space.|atmospheric escape

label: mass plasma flow
definition: A process whereby a large volume of plasma moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: water-based rainfall
definition: A hydrological precipitation process in which atmospheric water vapour condenses to form droplets of liquid water massive enough to fall to a planetary surface due to the planet's gravity.

label: virga
SYNONYMS: A process in which precipitation falls from a cloud but evaporates or sublimes before making contact with a planetary surface.

label: combustion process
definition: Combustion or burning is a high-temperature exothermic redox chemical reaction between a fuel and an oxidant that produces oxidized, often gaseous products, in a mixture termed as smoke.

label: thermolysis
definition: A chemical decomposition (the separation of a single chemical compound into its two or more elemental parts or to simpler compounds) caused by heat.

label: pyrolysis
definition: A thermolysis process in which organic material is decomposed in the absence of oxygen.

label: coral bleaching process
definition: An environmental process in which coral expels the symbiotic algae living in its tissue as a result of stress, causing the coral to turn white.

label: ground deformation process
definition: A process in which a solid planetary surface is deformed.

label: hailfall
definition: A hydrological process during which hail stones fall to the surface of an astronomical body.

label: precipitation process
definition: A precipitation process is a process in which a portion of some substance segregates from a material in which that substance or its precursors were dissolved or suspended in and settles due to a force such as gravity or centrifugal force.

label: storm
definition: A storm is an environmental process in which an environmental system and the processes it participates in are strongly perturbed by external forcings. These forcings typically increase the rates of processes unfolding in the system, relative to their normal rates.

label: atmospheric storm
definition: An atmospheric storm is a process in which a portion of an astronomical body's atmosphere is strongly perturbed from its prevaling weather.

label: thunderstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm which occurs in cumulonimbus clouds and during which lightning and thunder occur.

label: rainstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which intense rainfall occurs.

label: hailstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which intense hailfall occurs

label: snowstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which intense snowfall occurs.

label: icestorm
SYNONYMS: glaze event|glaze event|glaze storm|ice storm|silver storm|silver thaw|silver thaw
definition: An atmospheric storm during which freezing rain falls and accumulates as ice on exposed surfaces.

label: snowfall
definition: A hydrological process in which irregular aggregates of snow fall to the surface of an astronomical body.

label: freezing rainfall
definition: Water-based rainfall which freezes either 1) on impact with a surface to form a coating of clear ice (glaze) or 2) after percolating through surface layers.

label: electrostatic discharge process
definition: A process during which a sudden flow of electricity occurs, often accompanied by a visible release of photons, between two electrically charged objects due to contact, an electrical short, or dielectric breakdown.

label: atmospheric lightning
definition: A sudden electrostatic discharge which occurs during an electrical storm as differentially charged atmospheric entities equalise their charge.

label: intercloud lightning
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs between at least two clouds.

label: intracloud lightning
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs within a single cloud.

label: lightning strike
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs between a cloud and an object on a planetary surface, or a planetary surface itself.

label: lightning flash
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs within a single cloud or between multiple clouds.

label: blizzard
definition: A blizzard is a severe snowstorm during which snowfall is transported by strong winds, sustained for several hours.

label: ground blizzard
definition: A ground blizzard is a storm during which snow which has settled on a planetary surface is resuspended in and transported through its atmosphere by strong winds, sustained for several hours.

label: aquaculture process
definition: A process during which humans rear animals or plants in bodies of water for harvest and consumption.

label: nucleation of cloud condensation
definition: A process during which a solid particle or liquid droplet catalyses the condensation of water vapour in an atmosphere.

label: ice loss process
definition: A material decumulation process during which the mass of an existing ice mass decreases in size.

label: rubbish landslide
definition: A mass wasting process during which refuse from human activities, usually accumulated at a dumping site, falls down a slope under the force of gravity.

label: ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of an ice mass breaks away from the main mass.

label: glacial ice ablation process
definition: An ice loss process which occurs in the low-altitude area of a glacier or ice sheet below the firn layer.

label: water ice sublimation process
definition: A sublimation process during which water ice transitions into a gaseous state.

label: water ice formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which water ice is formed.

label: anthropisation
definition: A process during which a natural environmental system is altered by human action.

label: mass liquid flow
definition: A process whereby a volume of liquid moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: water flow process
definition: A material transport process during which a volume of liquid water is transported due to a disequilibria in physical forces.

label: manufacturing process
definition: A planned process during which raw or recycled materials are transformed into products for use or sale using labour and machines, tools, chemical and biological processing, or formulation.

label: planetary manufacturing process
definition: A manufacturing process which occurs on a planet.

label: human-directed construction process
definition: An process during which natural or manufactured materials and products are processed and arranged by humans or their technology into structures.

label: radiation
definition: A process during which energy is emitted or transmitted in the form of waves or particles through space or a material medium.

label: particle radiation
definition: A radiation process during which energy is transmitted or emitted by means of fast-moving subatomic particles.

label: particle beam radiation
definition: A particle radiation process during which subatomic particles move in the same direction.

label: electromagnetic radiation
definition: A radiation process during which waves (or their quanta, photons) of the electromagnetic field propagate (radiate) through space carrying electromagnetic energy.

label: acoustic radiation
definition: A radiation process during which mechanical waves generated by oscillations radiate through an environmental material.

label: impact between astronomical bodies
definition: An impact event is a collision between astronomical bodies.

label: meterorite impact
definition: An impact event during which a meteoroid collides with another astronomical body.

label: cloud formation process
definition: A process during which water vapour condensing in the atmosphere aggregates into clouds.

label: particulate matter formation process
definition: A process during which microscopic solid or liquid objects are formed.

label: atmospheric aerosol formation
definition: An aerosol formation process which occurs in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a solid aerosol in an atmosphere
SYNONYMS: formation of solid particles in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which an aerosol, consisting of solid particulates suspended in a gas, is formed in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a liquid aerosol in an atmosphere
SYNONYMS: formation of liquid droplets in an atmosphere|formation of liquid particles in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which an aerosol, consisting of droplets of liquid suspended in gas, is formed in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a solid aerosol from gaseous material in an atmosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: formation of a solid aerosol in an atmosphere
SYNONYMS: atmospheric formation of a solid aerosol|formation of a solid aerosol in an atmosphere|formation of a solid aerosol in the atmosphere|formation of solid particles from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which microscopic solid particulates are formed from gaseous materials in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a liquid aerosol from gaseous material in an atmosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: formation of a liquid aerosol in an atmosphere
SYNONYMS: atmospheric formation of a liquid aerosol|formation of a liquid aerosol in an atmosphere|formation of a liquid aerosol in the atmosphere|formation of liquid droplets from gaseous material in an atmosphere|formation of liquid particles from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which microscopic liquid droplets are formed from gaseous materials in an atmosphere.

label: tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move.

label: convergent tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move towards one another.

label: divergent tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move away from one another.

label: transform tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move along each other in a predominantly horizontal manner, either in a sinistral (left lateral) or dextral (right lateral) direction.

label: tectonic plate subduction
definition: A convergent tectonic movement process during which one plate moves under another and is forced or sinks due to gravity into a mantle.

label: rockslide process
definition: A rockslide is a process whereby a large mass of rock moves down a hill or a mountainside.

label: fossilization of organic material
definition: A process during which organic substances are replaced with mineral substrances, maintaining part of their anatomical organisation.

label: gravitational motion
definition: A process during which one or more entities move along geodesics in a region of spacetime that has been sufficiently curved towards an entity with sufficient mass and/or energy.

label: photoevaporation
definition: A process during which energetic radiation ionises gas and causes it to disperse away from the ionising source.

label: atmospheric escape
definition: A process during which gases that constitute a planetary atmosphere escape that planet's gravitational field and move away into outer space.

label: hydrodynamic escape
definition: An atmospheric escape process during which atoms that are parts of a planetary atmosphere escape into outer space through numerous collisions with lighter atoms in that atmosphere.

label: ecosystem fragmentation process
definition: A process during which one or more parts of an ecosystem become causally isolated such that the direct flow or exchange of materials, resources, and energy between a given fragment and the remainder of the original system is severely curtailed or entirely halted.

label: active ecosystem management process
definition: A process during which an ecosystem, its parts, or the processes it participates in are modified by human intervention to accomplish an objective.

label: conservation-focused active ecosystem management process
definition: An active management process which has the conservation of an ecosystem, or a part thereof, as its primary objective.

label: ecosystem decay
definition: A process during which an ecosystem fragment loses its system integrity, with many of its resident ecological populations 1) losing their habitats, 2) undergoing a loss of functional and phylogenetic diversity, and 3) undergoing a subsequent genetic destabilisation through inbreeding.

label: habitat fragmentation process
definition: An ecosystem fragmentation process during which discontinuities emerge in the habitats of one or more ecological populations.

label: lithification
definition: A process during which sediments compact under pressure, expel connate fluids, and gradually become solid sedimentary rock.

label: stellar radiation
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star.

label: microwave stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths and frequencies which travel exclusively in a line-of-sight fashion and which may produce molecular rotation and torsion on contact with matter.

label: radio wave stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths ranging from millimetre to kilometer scales.

label: infrared stellar radiation
SYNONYMS: IR stellar radiation|infra-red stellar radiation|infrared radiation|infrared solar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star when molecules change their rotational-vibrational movements, usually at wavelengths between 760 nm and 1 mm.

label: visible spectrum stellar radiation
SYNONYMS: optical stellar radiation|visible spectrum solar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths between 380 nm and 760 nm.

label: ultraviolet stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

label: X-ray stellar radiation
SYNONYMS: X-ray solar radiation|x ray stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted by high-energy electrons as they fall into a lower state of energy.

label: gamma-ray stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted from the radioactive decay (gamma decay) of atomic nuclei.

label: ionizing stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star with sufficient energy to disrupt molecular bonds or alter the electron number of atoms.

label: water accumulation process
definition: A process during which liquid water accumulates in a site, most often in some form of container.

label: lumber production process
definition: A process during which wood is processed into beams or planks.

label: agricultural process
definition: A process during which humans rear animals or plants on land for harvest and consumption.

label: agronomic process
definition: An agricultural process during which humans rear plants on land for harvest and consumption.

label: animal husbandry
definition: An agricultural process during which humans rear animals on land for harvest and consumption.

label: crustacean farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear crustaceans.

label: finfish farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear finfish.

label: mollusc farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear molluscs.

label: seaweed farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear seaweed.

label: freshwater macrophyte farming process
SYNONYMS: aquaculture of freshwater macrophytes|freshwater macrophyte aquaculture
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear freshwater macrophytes.

label: animal aquaculture process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear animals.

label: plant aquaculture process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear plants.

label: transport of waste to a designated storage site
definition: A process during which materials deemed to be waste are removed from a site and transported to another site designated for its storage.

label: waste disposal process
SYNONYMS: Abfallentsorgungsprozess|proceso de eliminación de residuos|processo di smaltimento rifiuti
definition: A process during which materials deemed to be waste are transported away from a site.

label: transport of child feces to a designated site
subClassOf [LABEL]: transport of waste to a designated storage site
definition: A waste disposal process during which the feces of human children is transported to a designated storage site.

label: transport of household waste to a designated storage site
subClassOf [LABEL]: transport of waste to a designated storage site
definition: A process during which materials used in a household and deemed to be waste are removed from the housing unit and transported to another site designated for its storage.

label: thermal pollution
definition: An environmental pollution process during which the temperature of an environmental system, or parts thereof, is raised above its natural levels.

label: thermal pollution of an aquatic system
definition: A thermal pollution process which occurs in a water body or aquatic environment.

label: industrial fire
definition: A fire which occurs in an industrial area or building.

label: brush fire
definition: A land fire which consumes low-growing plants such as scrub and brush.

label: bush fire
definition: A land fire which occurs in a large uncleared or sparsely settled area (as in Australia) usually scrub-covered or forested.

label: pasture fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a pastureland.

label: land fire
definition: A fire which occurs on land, typically consuming a terrestrial ecosystem as fuel.

label: convective storm
definition: An atmospheric storm which is generated by the heating and convection of moist and unstable air masses.

label: extra-tropical cyclone
definition: A warm-core cyclone which occurs in the middle and high latitudes, primarily drawing energy from horizontal temperature contrasts between atmospheric fronts.

label: tropical storm
definition: A an atmospheric storm which originates over tropical or subtropical waters and possesses a warm-core, non-frontal synoptic-scale cyclone with a low pressure centre, spiral rain bands and strong winds.

label: cyclone
definition: An atmospheric storm during which a large mass of atmospheric gas rotates around a centre of low atmospheric pressure, generating high winds which spiral towards that centre.

label: warm core cyclone
definition: A cyclone which rotates around an area low atmospheric pressure with increased temperature.

label: nitrogen cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has nitrogen-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: sulfur cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has sulfur-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: phosphorous cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has phosphorous-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: marine tidal flow process
definition: A tidal flow process which occurs in an ocean or sea and during which tidal movements generate advective flows, often amplified in velocity when moving through an inlet, pass or channel.

label: advective transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a volume of material is displaced due to a disequilibrium in physical forces and during which 1) the qualities that inhere in that volume and 2) the processes that are unfolding within it are largely unchanged.

label: diurnal marine tidal flow process
definition: A tidal flow process which occurs once per day in ocean waters where a second daily oscillation is blocked by land masses or ocean basin geometry.

label: tidal flow process
definition: A water flow process during which movements of water masses caused by varying gravitational and rotational forces from astronomical bodies, combined with the rotation of the astronomical body containing the water mass, cause waters to undergo periodic depth oscillations (tides).

label: semi-diurnal marine tidal flow process
definition: A marine tidal flow process which occurs twice per day, resulting in two high and two low tides per day, both of roughly equal amplitude.

label: erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one location on the surface of an astronomical body, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: atmospheric aerosolised particle formation event
SYNONYMS: rapid formation of liquid or solid particles from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: An aerosol formation event  which occurs in an atmosphere.

label: atmospheric secondary aerosol formation process
SYNONYMS: atmospheric formation of an aerosol|formation of an aerosol in an atmosphere|formation of an aerosol in the atmosphere|formation of liquid or solid particles from gaseous material in an atmosphere|formation of particles from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which gas-phase molecules form solid or liquid particles that are stable enough to continue growing in size - via the condensation or aggregation of other gas-phase molecules - at a greater rate than their constituents re-enter gas phase.

label: aerosolised particle formation process
definition: A process during which particles suspended in a gaseous medium are formed.

label: primary aerosol formation process
definition: A material transport process during which solid or liquid particles are directly introduced into a volume of gas.

label: secondary aerosol formation process
definition: An aerosol formation process during which solid or liquid particles are either 1) formed in a volume of gas through gas-to-liquid or gas-to-solid conversions or 2) increase in size through aggregation with other particles.

label: aerosolised particle formation event
definition: An aerosol formation process during which the rate of particle formation exceeds that which is normally present in the site of its occurrence.

label: secondary atmospheric aerosol formation event
SYNONYMS: atmospheric new particle formation event|rapid formation of liquid or solid particles from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: A secondary aerosol formation process which occurs in an atmosphere at an increased rate relative to background processes of the same kind.

label: accumulation of matter on aerosolised particles
aerosolisation of dust
definition: A primary aerosol formation process during which dust particles are suspended in a gaseous medium.

label: atmospheric aerosolisation of dust
definition: A process during which dust is aerosolised in an atmosphere.

label: haze formation process
definition: An environmental process during which a haze is formed by the aerosolisation of solid particles, including natural materials and anthropogenic pollutants, in an atmosphere.

label: haze formation event
definition: A haze formation process which has an increased rate relative to that which is usually present in a given site.

label: benthic deep-sea mining
definition: A mining process during which materials are extracted from benthic environments deep below the ocean surface, where no stellar radiation reaches..

label: sea bed mining
definition: A mining process during which materials are extracted from the surface, or below the surface, of the ocean floor.

label: land conversion process
definition: An anthropisation process during which terrestrial environments - natural or anthropised - or parts thereof are altered to facilitate human activities such as agriculture, settlement, or commerce.

label: agricultural land conversion process
definition: A land conversion process during which terrestrial ecosystems are altered to facilitate agricultural activities such as crop cultivation or the rearing of livestock.

label: land use process
definition: An anthropogenic environmental process which includes all human activities undertaken in a natural, semi-natural, or anthropised environment.

label: forestry
definition: A land use process during which humans access and manage forest ecosystems for 1) the provisioning of wood, forages, water, wildlife, and recreation as well as a broad range of other ecosystem services or 2) the maintenance of the forest ecosystem's health.

label: terrestrial mining
definition: A land use process during which materials of economic value are extracted from a planet, usually from an orebody, lode, vein, seam, reef or placer deposit.

label: anthropogenic ecosystem conversion process
definition: A process during which an ecosystem - natural or anthropised - is changed by the actions of humans.

label: planned deforestation
definition: Deforestation which is planned and executed by humans.

label: planned environmental usage process
definition: A planned process during which humans access and obtain resources, benefits, or services from a natural or anthropised ecosystem.

label: mining
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which a non-renewable resource such as petroleum, natural gas, or water is extracted from an ecosystem.

label: quarrying
definition: A mining process during which rock or mineral deposits are extracted from the terrestrial surface layers of an astronomical body.

label: marine mining
definition: A mining process which occurs in a marine ecosystem.

label: coal mining
definition: A mining process during which coal is extracted from the rocky portion of an astronomical body.

label: opencast mining
definition: A mining process during which metal ores and minerals that lie near the terrestrial surface of an astronomical body are extracted by removing the overlying material and breaking and loading the ore.

label: agriculture
definition: A land use process during which terrestrial environments are modified such that they can grow crop plants or allow the rearing of animals to provide food, fiber, medicines, or other products used by humans.

label: usage of an environment for recreation
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which humans access an environment in order to promote the refreshment of their physical and psychological health through relaxation and leisure activities.

label: usage of an environment for transportation
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment facilitates the movement of materials and material objects (persons or goods) from place to place, typically with the assistance of a vehicle.

label: usage of an environment for infrastructure and utilities
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports 1) enterprises concerned with the provision to the public of essentials, such as electricity or water or 2) the basic network or foundation of capital facilities or community investments which are necessary to support economic and community activities.

label: usage of an environment for residential activity
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports the settlement and dwelling of a community of humans.

label: usage of an environment for community and social services
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports welfare activities organised by the state or a local authority and carried out by trained personnel.

label: usage of an environment for retail activity
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports the sale of goods to ultimate consumers, usually in small quantities.

label: usage of an environment for defence
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports activities which aim to protect citizens or any geographical area by preparing for or by using military means to resist the attack of an enemy.

label: usage of an environment for industry
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports manufacturing facilities producing commodities that are sold with the expectation of recovering the total cost of production.

label: usage of an environment for business
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports facilities associated with commerce or the earning of a livelihood through means other than manufacturing or the provision of a public service.

label: satellite imaging of a planet
definition: A remote sensing process during which image data about a planet is generated by sensors mounted on a satellite.

label: thermokarst formation process
definition: A process by which landforms are formed from the thawing of ice-rich permafrost or the melting of massive ground ice.

label: active agri-ecosystem management process
definition: An active ecosystem management process which targets an agricultural ecosystem.

label: anthropogenic light pollution
definition: A pollution process during which artificial light with wavelengths in the visible spectrum is released into the environment.

label: radiation from a manufactured product
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a manufactured product.

label: visible spectrum radiation from a manufactured product
SYNONYMS: optical radiation from a manufactured product
definition: Radiation from a manufactured product during which light between the wavelenghts of 380 nm and 760 nm is emitted.

label: material congelation process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material's viscosity increase either through a reduction in temperature, through chemical reactions, or other physical effects.

label: mass ice flow
definition: An advective transport process during which a mass of ice is transported from one location to another.

label: freezing
definition: A material congelation process during which a liquid turns into a solid when its temperature is lowered below its melting point.

label: freezing of water into water ice
definition: A freezing process during which liquid water is transformed into water ice.

label: infrasound
definition: Sound which is lower in frequency than 20 Hertz, or cycles per second.

label: thawing process
definition: A warming process during which the thermal energy in a portion of environmental material is sufficient to melt water-based ice or snow.

label: material warming process
definition: A process during which the temperature of a portion of environmental material is increased, along with the kinetic energy of its constituent molecules.

label: permafrost thawing process
definition: A thawing process during which permafrost is warmed beyond the melting point of water-based ice, snow, or other forms of solid water.

label: material cooling process
definition: A process during which the temperature of a portion of environmental material is decreased, along with the kinetic energy of its constituent molecules.

label: snow accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of snow on a surface increases.

label: ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which ice forms in an environmental material or an existing accumulation of ice increases in mass.

label: snow and ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which a accumulation of snow and ice forms or increases in mass.

label: englacial process
definition: An environmental system process which occurs within a glacier or ice sheet.

label: submarine groundwater discharge process
definition: A water flow process during which fresh or brackish groundwater flows from from a landmass into the sea.

label: groundwater discharge process
definition: A water flow process during which water flows out of an aquifer.

label: groundwater flow
definition: A water flow process during which water is transported through an aquifer.

label: agricultural pollution
definition: An environmental pollution process during which contaminants derived from agricultural activity are released into an environmental system.

label: agricultural landscape diversification process
definition: An active agri-ecosystem management process during which the variability of land use types or the spatial structure of land under agricultural production is increased.

label: biodiversity conservation process
definition: A conservation process during which the variability of life - from genes to ecosystems - is preserved.

label: insect conservation process
definition: A biodiversity conservation process during which the variability of insect communities, or parts thereof, is preserved.

label: agricultural specialisation process
definition: An active agri-ecosystem management process during which an ecosystem is modified for the production of one or a small collection of crops or other agricultural products.

label: formation of a solid aerosol from liquid material in an atmosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: formation of a solid aerosol in an atmosphere
SYNONYMS: atmospheric formation of a solid aerosol|formation of a solid aerosol in an atmosphere|formation of a solid aerosol in the atmosphere|formation of solid particles from liquid material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which microscopic solid particulates are formed from liquid materials in an atmosphere.

label: glaciation of water droplets in a cloud
subClassOf [LABEL]: formation of a solid aerosol from liquid material in an atmosphere|hydrological process
definition: A process during which supercooled water droplets in a cloud freeze into ice crystals.

label: aerosol formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which solid or liquid particles form and are suspended in a mass of air, thus creating an aerosol.

label: glacial process
definition: An environmental process which involves glaciers or ice sheets.

label: glacial retreat
definition: A glacial ice loss process during which the snout (toe) of a glacier shrinks following successive years of negative mass balance.

label: calving of ice onto land
definition: An ice calving process during which a mass of ice falls from a larger mass onto land.

label: calving of ice into water
definition: An ice calving process during which a mass of ice falls from a larger mass into a body of water.

label: periglacial process
definition: A frost action process which occurs in cold environments which are not part of a glacier.

label: frost action process
definition: A material transport process during which alternate freezing and thawing of moisture in soil, rock and other materials results  modifications of those materials and in the formation of structures on, or in, the ground.

label: frost jacking
definition: A frost action process during which objects embedded in the ground are cumulatively displaced upwards.

label: frost sorting
definition: A frost action process during which the soil particles are differentially displaced according to their size ranges.

label: frost wedging
definition: A frost action process during which the pressure of water freezing in cracks, crevices, pores, joints or bedding planes results in the mechanical disintegration, splitting or break-up of rock.

label: cryoturbation of soil
definition: A frost action process during which soil is displaced.

label: glacial run
definition: A water flow process which comprises a sudden‐onset high‐magnitude discharge of water and sediment from a glacial source

label: mariculture process
definition: An aquaculture process during which marine organisms are cultivated in the open ocean, an enclosure in the ocean, or in tanks, ponds or raceways which are filled with seawater.

label: open cage mariculture process
definition: A mariculture process during which organisms are cultivated in cages which allow the passage of materials such as wastes, pathogens, antibiotics, and - should a containment breach occur - cultivated organisms themselves to and from the surrounding marine environment.

label: katabatic wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which cold atmospheric gas flows downwards towards the surface of an astronomical body.

label: downslope katabatic wind
definition: A katabatic wind during which atmospheric gas flows down the slope of an elevation, typically during periods of light larger-scale winds.

label: cooling-driven katabatic wind
definition: A katabatic wind which is driven by the cooling and subsequent sinking of atmospheric gas masses.

label: foehn wind
definition: A downslope katabatic wind during which warm, dry atmospheric gas descends along the lee side of a mountain range as a result of synoptic-scale, cross-barrier flow over that range.

label: adiabatic process
definition: An environmental process during which a system does not thermally interact with its surroundings by virtue of a temperature difference between them.

label: dry-adiabatic process
definition: An adiabatic process during which no condensation of water vapor occurs and no liquid water is present.

label: moist-adiabatic process
definition: An adiabatic process which involves air saturated with water vapour and the presence of liquid water.

label: fall wind
definition: A katabatic wind during which the low temperature and increased density of a cold mass of atmospheric gas accelerates its descent.

label: bora
definition: A fall wind which has a source so cold that, when the atmospheric gas reaches the lowlands or coast, the dynamic warming is insufficient to raise its temperature to the normal level for the region; hence it appears as a cold wind.

label: squall wind
definition: An atmospheric wind which rapidly forms, lasts for a duration in the order of minutes, and then rapidly decreases in speed.

label: nautical squall
definition: A storm which is nautical, localised, and of high severity local storm considered as a whole: that is, winds and cloud mass and (if any) precipitation, thunder and lightning.

label: jet-effect wind
definition: A wind which is driven by the acceleration of flow through a gap, constriction, or channel resulting from large-scale pressure gradient, or by Venturi acceleration through a constricting passage.

label: mountain-gap wind
definition: A jet-effect which passes through a gap, constriction, or channel between mountains in a mountain range or between ranges themselves.

label: slope flow
definition: An atmospheric wind which moves up or down a slope and is driven by heating or cooling of that slope.

label: anabatic wind
definition: An upslope wind driven by heating at the slope surface under fair-weather conditions.

label: insolation process
definition: A process during which direct stellar radiation interacts with a planetary surface.

label: cooling of a gas
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: cooling of a liquid
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of liquid environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: cooling of a solid
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of solid environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: cooling of a fluid
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of fluid environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: warming of a fluid
definition: A material warming process during which the thermal energy in a volume of fluid increases.

label: warming of a gas
definition: A process of warming a fluid during which the thermal energy in a volume of gas increases.

label: warming of a liquid
definition: A process of warming a fluid which includes a volume of liquid as a participant.

label: warming of a solid
definition: A material warming process during which the thermal energy in a mass of solid material increases.

label: drainage wind
definition: A downslope katabatic wind which is generated by the cooling of atmospheric gas in contact with terrain surfaces.

label: glacier wind
definition: A drainage wind which flows along the icy surface of a glacier.

label: mass fluid flow
definition: An advective transport process during which a fluid moves.

label: cyclonic circulation
definition: A mass fluid flow which moves  in the same direction as a planet's rotation, rotating due to a Coriolis effect.

label: wind storm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which winds flow with increased rates.

label: straight-line wind
definition: A wind storm during which strong gusts of wind occur, transporting atmospheric gas in a linear fashion.

label: downburst
definition: A downdraft which is of high intensity and which spreads radially, with high speed, across the planetary surface upon reaching it.

label: dry macroburst
definition: A macroburst during which no or very little rain is generated.

label: wet macroburst
definition: A macroburst during which large amounts of rain are generated.

label: microburst
definition: A downburst during which high winds occur over an area less than four kilometres in diameter.

label: macroburst
definition: A downburst during which high winds occur over an area larger than four kilometres in diameter.

label: wet microburst
definition: A microburst during which large amounts of rain are generated.

label: dry microburst
definition: A microburst during which no or very little rain is generated.

label: downdraft
definition: A katabatic wind which is sudden and strong.

label: vibration process
definition: A material transport process during which parts of an elastic material oscillate around their positions of equilibrium.

label: seismic vibration process
definition: A vibration process which occurs in the solid parts of an astronomical body as low-frequency acoustic waves pass through them.

label: volcanic seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by a volcanic eruption.

label: impact-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by the impact of a solid object on the surface of an astronomical body.

label: impact event
definition: An impact event is a collision between material entities, resulting in changes in one or both of those entities.

label: explosion-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by an explosion.

label: mass-wasting-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by mass wasting.

label: collapse-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by the collapose of a material entity, sending kinetic energy into astronomical body.

label: structural collapse process
definition: A process during which the ability of a material entity to maintain its internal organisation fails, resulting in deformation and a breakdown of that organisation.

label: cave collapse
definition: A structural collapse process during which the walls of cave are unable to support the load placed upon them.

label: earthquake-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by an earthquake.

label: foreshock
definition: A tectonic earthquake which precedes the strongest tectonic earthquake in a series, linked to the same release of energy in the crust.

label: mainshock
definition: A tectonic earthquake which 1) is embedded in a series of tectonic earthquakes, linked to the same release of energy in the crust and 2) has the largest magnitude of the series.

label: aftershock
definition: A tectonic earthquake which 1) is embedded in a series of tectonic earthquakes, linked to the same release of energy in the crust and 2) occurs after the mainshock.

label: blind thrust earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which occurs along a thrust fault which does not breach the surface of an astronomical body.

label: multiplet tectonic earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which has two or more mainshocks of similar magnitude, and which originate from the same fracture zone and stress field.

label: interplate earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which occurs at the boundary between two tectonic plates.

label: intraplate earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which occurs within the interior parts of a tectonic plate.

label: ecosystem process
definition: An environmental process either driven by or primarily impacting the parts or emergent properties of an ecosystem.

label: ecological succession
definition: An ecosystem process during which the species composition of an ecosystem gradually changes as species which are more adapted to the prevailing conditions in the ecosystem replace those which are less adapted.

label: climactic ecological succession
definition: An ecological succession process during which 1) organisms in ecological communities possess high adaptation to the conditions in the ecosystem, 2) participant communities largely fill available niches, 3) individual organisms are typically replaced by others of the same species, 4) a near equilibrium is maintained between gross primary production and total respiration and across biogeochemical cycles.

label: momentum transfer process
definition: An environmental process during which momentum is transferred from one material entity to another.

label: atmosphere-ocean momentum transfer process
definition: A momentum transfer process which unfolds as winds generate drag at the bottom of the atmosphere,coupled to dynamical forcing at the surface of the ocean.

label: energy transfer process
definition: A process during which one entity loses energy to another entity.

label: liquid accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the volume of liquid entity increases.

label: outgoing longwave radiation
SYNONYMS: outgoing long-wave radiation|terrestrial long-wave flux|up-welling long-wave radiation
definition: An infrared radiation process which 1) transmits radiant energy has wavelengths between 3.0 and 100 μm, 2) is emitted from a planet and its atmosphere out to space in the form of thermal radiation.

label: wind gust
definition: An atmospheric wind which 1) has an increased rate relative to other winds in the same region and 2) is followed by a lull.

label: shortwave radiation
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which radiant energy with wavelengths in the visible, near-ultraviolet, or near-infrared spectra is realised.

label: photosynthetically active radiation
definition: Electromagnetic radidation which involves radiant energy in a spectral range (wave band) between 400 to 700 nanometers, that photosynthetic organisms are able to use in the process of photosynthesis.

label: well intervention
definition: A planned process during which an oil or gas well is modified.

label: well stimulation
definition: A well intervention during which the production of an oil or gas well is increased by improving the flow of hydrocarbons from the reservoir into the well bore.

label: hydraulic fracturing
definition: A well stimulation technique during which bedrock formations are fractured through the injection of pressurized proppant-bearing liquid into a well-bore.

label: debris flow following rainfall
definition: A debris flow which is causally preceded by rainfall.

label: percolation of water through soil
definition: Percolation during which water moves through the interstices of soil.

label: percolation
definition: A material transport process during which a fluid is filtered through porous soild or semi-solid materials.

label: drainage process
definition: A material transport process during which a liquid which is not absorbed or otherwise held in place by a material is transported away from its location.

label: convective transport process
definition: A material transport process which arises spontaneously due to physical heterogeneities in a portion of a material and forces which act throughout its volume.

label: material diffusion process
definition: A material transport process during which material moves from a region of higher concentration to a region of lower concentration.

label: irradiation
definition: An energy transfer process during which a material entity receives energy through radiation.

label: irradiation by ionizing radiation
definition: Irradiation during which a material entity receives energy through ionizing radiation.

label: irradiation by non-ionizing radiation
definition: Irradiation during which a material entity receives energy through non-ionizing radiation.

label: irradiation by photosynthetically active radiation
definition: Irradiation during which a material entity receives energy through photosynthetically active radiation.

label: peat drainage
definition: A drainage process during which water is transported away from peat.

label: transportation
definition: A planned process that is the movement of people, animals and goods from one location to another.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: desertification
definition: A type of land degradation in which terrestrial ecosystem becomes increasingly dry, typically losing its bodies of water as well as vegetation and wildlife.

label: flooding
definition: A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from the overflow of inland and/or tidal waters, and/or the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source. A great flow along a watercourse or a flow causing inundation of lands not normally covered by water.

label: atmospheric process
definition: A process which occurs within an atmosphere.

label: greenhouse effect
definition: A process by which thermal radiation from a planetary surface is absorbed by atmospheric greenhouse gases, and is re-radiated in all directions. Since part of this re-radiation is back towards the surface and the lower atmosphere, it results in an elevation of the average surface temperature above what it would be in the absence of the gases.

label: land degradation
definition: A process which diminishes the functioning of an ecosystem located on land.

label: ecosystem-wide photosynthesis
definition: A process which consists of all photosynthesis processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: ecosystem-wide respiration
definition: A process which consists of all respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: biogeochemical cycling
definition: A biogeochemical process during which one or more chemical compounds are sequentially converted into a series of related compounds in a regularly repeating, periodic fashion.

label: carbon cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has carbon-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: afforestation
definition: Establishment of a new forest by seeding or planting of nonforested land.

label: deforestation
definition: An ecosystem process during which the flora and fauna belonging to a forest are removed or destroyed.

label: reforestation
definition: The planting of trees in areas in where forests have previously been cleared.

label: algal bloom process
definition: A process during which the populations in a community of algae in a marine or freshwater ecosystem undergo rapid growth, resulting in high concentrations of algal cells that occur only periodically and briefly in that ecosystem, relative to their concentrations through the majority of the planetary orbital period.

label: algal bloom collapse
definition: A process during which the rapid growth of algal populations that result in an algal bloom ceases, and cell densities begin to fall due to death, predation, and transport.

label: algal production
definition: A process during which the algal cells constituting an algal bloom produce biomass from abiotic components during photosynthesis.

label: accumulation of toxins from algal bloom process
degradation of toxins from algal bloom process
anthropogenic environmental process
definition: An environmental process which is driven by the action of humans.

label: planetary erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one part of a planet's crust, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: bedrock dissolution
definition: An erosional process in which bedrock is converted from its solid form into a solute by the action of some solvent.

label: biogeochemical process
definition: A process during which chemicals that are involved in natural ecosystem processes are transported or transformed, and which impact the activity of biological entities

label: hydrological process
definition: An environmental process which has water - in any of its states - as a participant.

label: planned revegetation
definition: A planned process during which human agents establish plant communities in ecosystems which have previously been, partially or wholly, stripped of existing plant communities.

label: evapotranspiration
definition: Evapotranspiration is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth's land and ocean surface to the atmosphere.

label: evaporation
definition: Evaporation is a form of vaporisation which occurs when a portion of the surface layer of a liquid in contact with a gaseous material, which is not saturated with the evaporating substance, vaporises.

label: transpiration
definition: Transpiration is the process of water movement through a plant and its evaporation from aerial parts of that plant, such as from leaves but also from stems and flowers.

label: environmental pollution
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: air pollution
definition: A pollution process during which particulates or other contaminants are released into a portion of air.

label: soil pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into soil.

label: water pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into water.

label: plastic pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: urban pollution
definition: A pollution process that results in increased levels of pollutants in an urban environment.

label: nivation
definition: A material transformation process during which recently precipitated, powdery snow transitions into firn or névé through compaction and/or through cycles of freezing and thawing.

label: glacial erosion process
definition: An erosion process during which the movement of a glacier across a terrestrial surface causes the removal of material from that surface.

label: compaction process
definition: A physical process during which atoms, molecules, or other consituents of a material entity are forced closer together.

label: material accumulation process
definition: A process during which the mass of one or more materials, present within a given site, increases.

label: material transport process
definition: A process during which material is displaced from its original location and transported either to a new location or back to the original location.

label: ice gain
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of an existing ice mass increases.

label: glacial transport process
definition: A material transport process during which the snow and ice constituting a glacier, and anything contained within it, is transported down a slope by gravitation.

label: material decumulation process
definition: A process during which a mass composed of one or more environmental materials, present within a given site, decreases.

label: glacial ice loss
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier decreases.

label: aeolian transport process
definition: A material transport process during which one or more environmental materials are transported by the action of wind.

label: glacial ice gain
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier increases.

label: glacial ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass.

label: iceberg calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass as an iceberg.

label: calving of ice from an iceberg
definition: A process during which a part of an iceberg breaks away from the main mass.

label: sedimentation in a water body
definition: A material accumulation process during which solid particles are pulled through a water body by gravitation or centrifugal force and which ends when they settle on a solid surface.

label: brine channel formation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which brine droplets, trapped between ice crystals formed during seawater freezing, form brine channels.

label: material transformation process
definition: A process during which a portion of some environmental material is converted into a different material or a collection of materials.

label: sea ice formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which seawater freezes into sea ice.

label: brine rejection from seawater
definition: A material transformation process during which brine is formed due to the expulsion of salt during frazil formation or a seawater freezing process.

label: frazil ice formation
definition: A new ice formation process during which small, needle-like crystals consisting of nearly pure fresh water, form due to the freezing of open, turbulent, supercooled water.

label: depositional process
definition: A process during which material entities are added to a landform or to a feature upon the landform.

label: desublimation of water vapour into ice
definition: A desublimation process during which water vapour is frozen into water ice.

label: new ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which water is frozen into a form of new ice such as frazil, grease ice, slush, or shuga.

label: nilas formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which new ice crystals freeze together, forming nilas, a thin, elastic, continuous, ice sheet of a transparent gray color.

label: young ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which water freezes to the bottom of an existing nilas ice floe creating a thicker ice floe known as young ice.

label: first year ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto young ice during the cold season, forming first year ice.

label: second year ice formation
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto first year ice during the cold season, forming second year sea ice.

label: multiyear ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes into second year ice during the cold season, forming multiyear ice.

label: slush formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which slush ice is formed.

label: shuga formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which shuga is formed.

label: ice-bearing permafrost thawing process
subClassOf [LABEL]: hydrological process|permafrost thawing process|warming of a liquid|warming of a solid
definition: A permafrost thawing process during which water-based ice or snow present in permafrost is converted into meltwater.

label: explosion process
definition: A process during which a material entity undergoes a rapid increase in volume, releasing gasses and various forms of energy, often including thermal, light and sound energy.

label: permafrost methane explosion
definition: An explosion during which methane-rich gas trapped in permafrost combusts.

label: gas emission process
definition: A material transport process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material is transported into the atmosphere.

label: hydrocarbon gas emission process
definition: A gas emission process during which a portion of hydrocarbon gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: methane gas emission process
definition: A hydrocarbon gas emission process during which a portion of methane gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: season generating process
definition: A process during which the intesity of stellar radiation received by a planet's surface varies in a cyclical regime due to the planet's orbital motion around the barycentre of a planetary system and/or the tilt of its rotational axis relative to its orbital plane.

label: seasonal melting process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material entity melts during a warm season.

label: solid-phase sintering
definition: A compaction process during which a material entity subjected to heat and/or pressure is compacted into a solid mass without undergoing melting.

label: glacial sintering
definition: A sintering process during which snow is compacted into glacial ice.

label: aeolian transport of snow
definition: An aeolian transport process during which powdery snow is displaced and moved.

label: snow drift formation
definition: An accumulation process during which a powdery snow carried on the wind settles on a solid surface, forming a mound.

label: slab avalanche
definition: A mass wasting process during which slab snow rapidly moves down a sloping surface.

label: powdery snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which powdery snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: wet snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which a suspension of water and snow flows down a sloping surface.

label: erosion through nivation
definition: An erosion process during which rock or soil is removed or degraded due to alternative thawing and freezing of meltwater beneath and at the margins of snowbanks.

label: planned burn
definition: A fire which is planned and executed deliberately under human supervision.

label: acid rainfall
definition: A water-based rainfall process during which water droplets with increased acidity fall towards a planetary surface.

label: monsoon wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which air masses over an ocean flow towards a land mass, driven by disequilibria between land and ocean surface temperatures.

label: grass fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a grassland, combusting biomass stored in grasses as its primary fuel.

label: WMO blizzard
definition: A blizzard which 1) lasts at least 3 hours, 2) combines below freezing temperatures and very strong wind, laden with blowing snow.

label: NSIDC blizzard
definition: A blizzard which has 1) winds of 35 miles per hour (approximately 56 kilometers per hour), 2) lasts for a period of at least three hours, and 3) occurs in extremely cold temperatures.

label: winter blizzard
definition: A blizzard which occurs in winter.

label: water cooling
definition: A material transport process during which liquid water is circulated in the vicinity of a heat source in order to absorb thermal energy and transport it away form that source.

label: heavy snowfall
definition: Snowfall which has an increased rate.

label: lake-effect snowfall
definition: Snowfall which 1) is localized, 2) is convective, and 3) occurs as a result of a cold, dry air mass absorbing heat and moisture as it flows over a lake with warmer waters.

label: lake-effect snow storm
definition: A snowstorm during which intense lake-effect snowfall occurs.

label: lambing storm
definition: A snowfall which occurs during springtime and is of low intensity.

label: precipitation of sleet
definition: A hydrological precipitation process during which water falls in both liquid and frozen form.

label: ultrasound radiation
definition: An acoustic radiation process during which waves that transmit sound energy at frequencies above 20 kHz are emitted by a source.

label: mid-infrared radiation
definition: An infrared radiation during which waves with frequencies between 30 THz and 120 THz and with wavelengths between 10 micrometers and 2.5 micrometers are emitted by a source.

label: near-infrared radiation
definition: An infrared radiation during which waves with frequencies between 120 THz and 400 THz and with wavelengths between 2.5 micrometers and 750 nanometers are emitted by a source.

label: far-infrared radiation
definition: An infrared radiation which consists of waves with frequencies between 300 GHz and 30 THz and with wavelengths between 1 mm and 10 micrometers are emitted by a source.

label: famine
definition: An environmental system process during which populations have reduced access to food, causing increased hunger, malnutrition, and consequent mortality.

label: adfreezing
definition: Adfreezing is a freezing process during which two objects adhere to each other via ice.

label: frost heaving process
definition: Frost heaving is a process during which an upwards swelling of soil occurs due to freezing conditions caused by an increasing presence of ice as it grows towards the surface.

label: carbon sequestration process
definition: A material accumulation process during which atmospheric carbon dioxide is captured and stored.

label: biotic carbon sequestration
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which atmospheric carbon dioxide is captured and stored by biological processes.

label: geological carbon sequestration
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which carbon dioxide is stored in underground geological formations.
